remarks: Induction on the upper set of integers that starts at an integer ` M ` .  The first four hypotheses give us the substitution instances we need, and the last two are the basis and the induction step. (Contributed by NM, 7-Sep-2005.)
statement:
uzind4.1 $e |- ( j = M -> ( ph <-> ps ) ) $.
uzind4.2 $e |- ( j = k -> ( ph <-> ch ) ) $.
uzind4.3 $e |- ( j = ( k + 1 ) -> ( ph <-> th ) ) $.
uzind4.4 $e |- ( j = N -> ( ph <-> ta ) ) $.
uzind4.5 $e |- ( M e. ZZ -> ps ) $.
uzind4.6 $e |- ( k e. ( ZZ>= ` M ) -> ( ch -> th ) ) $.
uzind4 $p |- ( N e. ( ZZ>= ` M ) -> ta ) $.
$d M j k $.
$d N j $.
$d ch j $.
$d j ps $.
$d j ta $.
$d j th $.
$d k ph $.
